project_description: A simple Flutter app that displays a text with an icon. The text changes from 'Cat' with a clock icon to 'Dog' with a person icon when clicked.
architecture_overview: The app follows the Cubit pattern for state management to handle text and icon changes. It uses a modularized structure with separate folders for widgets, cubits, models, and screens.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: Open App
HomeScreen -> TextWidget: Display Initial Text
TextWidget -> TextCubit: onTap
TextCubit -> TextState: Change State
TextState -> TextWidget: Update Text and Icon
@enduml
state_management_flow: The app uses the Cubit pattern for state management. The TextCubit manages the state of the text and icon. When the user taps the text, the changeText method is called, updating the state with a new text and icon.
navigation_flow: The app consists of a single screen, HomeScreen, which contains the TextWidget. There is no additional navigation required.
